p: Human parainfluenza virus (HPIV), first discovered in the late 1950s, is an important cause of ARI in children, accounting for 2–17% of hospitalized cases [ 38– 40]. There are four types of HPIV, HPIV 1–4. HPIV-1 to HPIV-3 are common causes of ARI in infants and young children, while HPIV-4 is less commonly associated with respiratory illness [ 41]. Serologic studies have demonstrated that almost all children between 6 and 10 years of age have evidence of past infection, suggesting mild or asymptomatic primary infections [ 42].
